fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Re-linking an Atlassian Account to an IDP account leads to a login error if the old Atlassian Account is deactivated before the user's next login

h3. Steps to Reproduce

1. As the end user, SSO login into Atlassian (ie. _primaryemail@domain.com_) 

2. On org managed accounts, change the email address of the account to something else. (ie. _primaryemail@domain.com -> primaryemail_free@domain.com_ )

3. Deactivate the old account in managed accounts (ie. _primaryemail_free@domain.com_)

4. In AA org managed accounts, migrate another existing Atlassian account to use the SSO email address. (ie. _alias@domain.com -> primaryemail@domain.com_)

5. As the end user, try to perform an SSO login again. 

h3. Expected Results

The user should be able to login into Atlassian Account that matches the SSO email address. 

h3. Actual Results

After a successful authentication on the IDP, the user is redirected to a login error on Atlassian side. 

{panel}
Hmm... We're having trouble logging you in.
This account has been deactivated. Please contact your organization admin
{panel}

 !Error.png|thumbnail! 


h3. Workaround

Reactivate the old account to allow the re-link to happen. 

As the org admin, reactivate the old account (ie.  primaryemail_free@domain.com)
As the end user, perform an SSO login to re-link (ie. primaryemail@domain.com)
As the org admin, deactivate and delete the old account again (ie.  primaryemail_free@domain.com)
fields.summary: SAML re-link failure for deactivated accounts

fields.description:
h3. Problem Description
When a user tries to log in to [https://id.atlassian.com] and the user is logged in with a google email address in the browser, the user receives an option on the top right to *SignIn to id.atlassian.com with Google* even when this gsuite domain is not integrated with any Atlassian cloud:
 !Screenshot 2020-05-13 at 7.40.05 PM.png|thumbnail! 


h3. Suggested Resolution
Remove the *SignIn to id.atlassian.com with Google*  in the login page when the gsuite domain is not integrated with the Atlassian cloud.
fields.summary: Disable SignIn to id.atlassian.com with Google option

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When signing up in Trello, users may encounter an error when signing up with Google. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to https://trello.com/signup
 # Click on *Continue with Google*
 # Sign in using the Google account. 

h3. Expected Results

User should be allowed to sign up in Trello

h3. Actual Results

Error is returned 

{code}
{"error":"SIGNUP_MANAGED_ATLASSIAN_ACCOUNT_RESTRICTION","message":"Email is restricted to Atlassian account signup"}"
{code}

h3. Workaround

Do not use the Google option from the Trello sign up page. 

- Go to https://trello.com/signup
- Enter the email address and click on *Continue*
- On the next page (id.atlassian.com), use the *Continue with Google*
fields.summary: Google users failing to signup in Trello

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

If a blog owner shares a Blog with a group and lets say this user groups have users without Site Access, an access request will be created on behalf of the Blog owner for these users' product access (confluence) in this case. Usually the Blog Owners are unaware of the fact that they have requested for access for the users who are no longer part of their Userbase.

h3. Suggested Solution

Make the "Request Access " on behalf of other users feature more transparent, so when a Blog is shared, current users are aware of the fact that they are requesting for access for other Users and then decide accordingly.

*Current Workaround*

While disabling the user's Site access, they have to be removed from all the groups they are a member of so an access request is not created for them if a permission is granted to the groups.
fields.summary: Improvement to Access Request Feature

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Signing up to a managed domain using the "Login with Google" button results in an error: "Email is restricted to Atlassian account signup"

the account creation page, enter your email address in the email field first, and then proceed onto the next account creation screen where you may then use the Google button to complete the account registration.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # On the account creation page, without entering an email, click "Continue with Google"
 # Error will show: "Email is restricted to Atlassian account signup"

h3. Expected Results

The user should be able to use their existing Google login to signup for an Atlassian account
h3. Actual Results

The user receives an error. 

{code}
{"error":"SIGNUP_MANAGED_ATLASSIAN_ACCOUNT_RESTRICTION","message":"Email is restricted to Atlassian account signup"}"
{code}

h3. Workaround

Do not use the Google option from the Trello sign up page.

- Go to https://trello.com/signup
- Enter the email address and click on Continue
- On the next page (id.atlassian.com), use the Continue with Google
fields.summary: Signing up for a Trello account with a Google login gives an error "Email is restricted to Atlassian account signup"

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Sometimes when a user tries to create a new Trello account that ends up being managed, they cannot find the verification email in their inbox. Therefore, the banner message to confirm their email is always displayed on their Trello account.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a new Trello account linked to an Atlassian account
 # Try to confirm your account by using the links to send an email

h3. Expected Results

An email is available to the user through their mail client.
h3. Actual Results

User is not able to find the email.
h3. Workaround

The user can reset their Atlassian account password at [https://id.atlassian.com/login/resetpassword], which will confirm the account.
fields.summary: Some newly created Atlassian accounts from Trello are not able to confirm their accounts

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Some companies have multiple sites and sites admins, org admins and IDP admins might be different people.
If a site admin requests a group to be unassigned from the IDP, users will be deactivated and it might impact different sites. Also, if and IDP group is provisioned and removed, it might impact other sites.

h3. Suggested Solution
On site management, add a flag to the provisioned groups shared with multiple sites

h3. Workaround 
N/A
fields.summary: Add a flag to the provisioned groups shared with multilple sites

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

From [https://support.google.com/accounts/troubleshooter/1699308?visit_id=637242348410340378-2424293974&hl=en&rd=1#ts=1699315]:

A Google Account may be created using any standard email address that can receive mail. Because of this, you may have used your G Suite email address to create a _conflicting account_. A conflicting account is a personal Google Account that was created using the email address of a G Suite account. For this reason, any G Suite user could have two accounts with the same email address.

*Here's a common scenario*
 # Jane decides to go to www.google.com/photos and creates a Google Account with her corporate email address 'Jane@altostrat.com.'
 # Jane's company, Altostrat, upgrades to G Suite – which means each employee's email address is now that employee's username for a corporate Google Account.
 # Jane now has two Google Accounts – one G Suite account, and one Google Account, that share the same primary email address, but are completely unrelated.The most common reason that you may have a conflicting account is that you used Google Reader, Google Voice, or Picasa Web Albums with your *@my-domain.com* email.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Having a Google Account created with the corporate email address prior to having G Suite on the company, login to Atlassian using social login.
 # (System) A link is now created using the Google ID of this account into the Atlassian account.
 # Company now has a SAML integration, the end user logs in by company SSO, creating the SAML ID link with the Atlassian account.
 # Company now has G Suite in place. (Not integrated with Atlassian)
 # (System) Google now changes the pre-G Suite Google Account email to @gtempaccount.com
 # End user uses social login again with Atlassian with an existing session for the pre-G Suite Google Account.

h3. Expected Results

With SAML SSO in place, the Google ID should have been cleared from the account, so no profile changes are propagated from Google anymore through social link.
h3. Actual Results

The Atlassian account gets updated from Google to [name%domain@gtempaccount.com|mailto:name%domain@gtempaccount.com]
h3. Notes

The issue can reoccur if the end user uses social login again.
h3. Workaround

If the new gtempaccount.com email address is still accessible, perform an email change back to the original one, if another Atlassian account is already using it, access the new duplicated account and change its email to an alias such as name+alias@domain.com, then perform the change on the original account.
 * [https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloudkb/changing-atlassian-account-email-addresses-969508513.html]

If you are not able to perform the steps above, please engage our Atlassian support by raising a ticket on our support.atlassian.com portal.
fields.summary: Social log in causing email change to @gtempaccount.com for SAML linked accounts

fields.description:

However, Org admins can't define Trello access for managed accounts.

Please unify the products from a user management perspective, so that access can be granted easier to any of the Atlassian products.

Defining a domain to aprove site access allows regular users to add and grant new users with product access

fields.description:
Please provide an ability to link 2 Atlassian organization with the same G Suite Account(single G suit account).

Currently, if we try to link two Atlassian organizations with G suit it states that the G Suite organization is already linked to another Atlassian organization.

Test case: 
1.I have two Atlassian organisations "abc" and "xyz".
2.I want to link them both to the same G Suite account "AAA"
3.When I try to do that for "abc" it correctly states that the G Suite organization "AAA" is already linked to another Atlassian organization "xyz"
fields.summary: Ability to link more than one org with a G suit account

fields.description:
This is coming out of a discussion with eco-system and Identity teams on misuse of api token.

Eventually ecosystem decide on the overall strategy around API token usage. But before that,  we should be able to at least have the information on api token access. Admin need to at least be able to know what resources api token accessed at what time.
Suggest event to be include:
api token creation/deletion
api token access resource

This work will need both identity and Admin Experience team's effort. So this ticket is for identity side of work

Hope this is the right place for it.
fields.summary: Ability to have api token related event in audit log

fields.description:
h2.Problem
It's not possible to see in the admin page, G Suite tab, who is the user that set the G Suite integration.

h2.Suggestion
Add a field in the G Suite tab showing the information. That will allow users to manage G Suite admins without causing problems to the integration.
fields.summary: It's not possible to see in the admin page, G Suite tab, who is the user that set the G Suite integration

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When a tenant that is linked to an Atlassian organization is destroyed, it removes all the verified domains in this org from verification

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a test site and link it to a test organization that has at least one verified domain
# Proceed with deleting the test site 

h3. Expected Results
The site in unliked from the org and the site is destroyed without impacting org and its verified domains.

h3. Actual Results
When the site gets destroyed, it removes the org's verified domain from verification. In the organization audit log, there will be an entry that Atlassian Internal System has removed the domain from verification
 !log.png|thumbnail! 

h3.Workaround
Unlink the site from the organization before deleting the site.
fields.summary: When a tenant that is linked to an Atlassian organization is destroyed, it removes all the verified domains in this org from verification

fields.description:
User reported this via CAC: [https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Trello-questions/Can-t-sign-up-for-Trello-account-using-Microsoft-365-account/qaq-p/1353985]

Hello,

I am trying to sign up for a Trello account using "Continue with Microsoft" sign up feature. I am working to get my entire organization to use Trello and using the Microsoft sign up feature would be a low hurdle for everyone to overcome. We're a nonprofit and use a .org email address.

Does anyone know how I could possibly fix this? See below for error message from Atlassian:
h2. Hmm... We're having trouble logging you in.

Sorry, we had trouble logging you in with your Microsoft account. Your specific Azure Active Directory configuration is not currently supported. We are working on it!

For now, please enter your email in the login form and click continue and we will direct you to the most appropriate login method.
fields.summary: User can't sign up for Trello account using Microsoft 365 account (need help)

fields.description:
{panel:title=Bug Fix Policy|titleBGColor=#e0efff}
At the moment, we can't set an ETA for the fix to be released, since there's a number of factors that determine how our product team prioritizes bugfixes.
 Consider adding yourself as a watcher to be kept informed as to the state of the bug moving forward. With that way, if our development team updates the ticket, you'll be notified via email.
 You can learn more by reading [Atlassian Cloud Bug Fixing Policy|https://confluence.atlassian.com/support/atlassian-cloud-bug-fixing-policy-206865884.html].
{panel}
h3. Issue Summary

Users on managed accounts cannot disable their two-step verification if the organization enforces the two-step verification. Although that is expected behavior, the system doesn't take account of it.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an organization (without user provisioning) and enforce 2-step verification
 # As a managed user, try to disable the 2SV at [https://id.atlassian.com/manage-profile/security/two-step-verification]
 # Notice that the system shows "Something went wrong"

!Screenshot 2020-04-20 20.29.45.png|thumbnail!
h3. Expected Results

Show a specific error message corresponding to the Atlassian Access setting.
h3. Actual Results

The system shows a general error saying "Something went wrong".

The relevant POST request towards [https://id.atlassian.com/manage/rest/two-step-verification/unenroll] gets a 403 response with the content body below:
{code:none}
The request was a legal request, but the server is refusing to respond to it.
{code}
h3. Workaround

The organization admin can temporarily exclude users from two-step verification.
 Refer to [https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/enforced-two-step-verification-938859738.html] for more details.

!Screenshot 2020-04-20 20.57.36.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: 2SV enforced user only sees "Something went wrong" when trying to disable 2SV

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When creating an Atlassian account, there is a validation check on the *Enter full name* box that blocks emails from being used as your full name.

 !Sign_up_-_Log_in_with_Atlassian_account.png|thumbnail! 

Once the account is created, the validation check is no longer there and you can use an email as you _Full name_ or _Public name_ which is not ideal and comes with its own risks.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an Atlassian account through the [signup page|https://id.atlassian.com/signup] with a normal full name
 # Go to your [Profile And Visibility|https://id.atlassian.com/manage-profile/profile-and-visibility] settings and change your *Full name* or *Public name* to an actual email.

h3. Expected Results

There should be a validation check that blocks you from doing so, prohibiting the format of "string+@+domain".

h3. Actual Results

 !Atlassian_account.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behaviour. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Full name email check is not implemented once an account is created

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Unlicensed product users are prompted with a screen indicating a delay rather than a product licensing problem

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a user with Confluence license only, but not Jira.
# Attempt accessing a Jira issue via direct link to issue ie: https://<myinstance>.atlassian.net/browse/<issue number>
> user is prompted with a screen where he can request access - this is expected
# *However* when same user attempts accessing a Jira board URL via direct link. User gets the message "Your operation is taking longer than usual"

h3. Expected Results
The user should be prompted to request access the same as for the Jira issue.

h3. Actual Results
The user gets the message "Your operation is taking longer than usual"

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behaviour. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Unlicensed product users are prompted with a screen indicating a delay rather than a product licensing problem

fields.description:
As a user, we don't have knowledge about the error when the G Suite sync fails because the initiator no longer has G Suite admin rights.

It only displays that an unexpected error happened and to try again or contact support.

It would be good if the error points to the information that the G Suite sync failed because the initiator no longer has G Suite admin rights.
fields.summary: Provide a more detailed response when G Suite sync fails because the initiator no longer has G Suite admin rights

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Users on managed account (without Atlassian Access) cannot set up individual 2FA

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # As a managed user without Atlassian Access, login to https://id.atlassian.com/manage-profile/security/two-step-verification
 # Notice that 2FA is not available, even though there is no identity provider involved

h3. Expected Results
Managed users can enable 2FA individually

h3. Actual Results

An error is thrown, mentioning that the org admin mandated an IDP login. However, no IDP is involved:
 !2FA_error.png|thumbnail! 


h3. Workaround

Remove the verified domain.

 !Screenshot 2020-04-13 17.47.44.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Users on managed account (without Atlassian Access) cannot set up individual 2FA

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Improve the username update behavior for linked G Suite instance users that are not included in the synced group

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Integrate a Cloud site with a G Suite instance
# Sync one of the G Suite groups
# The users that belong to the G Suite group will be added to the site.
** At the same time, for all the users that use the domain managed by the G Suite instance, their Atlassian accounts will be managed by G Suite. This disables updating their username from id.atlassian.com
# From G Suite, update the username of a user that doesn't belong to the synced group

h3. Expected Results
The Atlassian account username is updated

h3. Actual Results
The Atlassian account username is not updated.

h3. Problem Definition
Since the users' Atlassian account is managed by G Suite, updating the username from id.atlassian.com is disabled. For this, there is no way for the affected user to update their username

h3. Suggested Solution
Upon the four hours interval group-to-site sync, sync the users' information that don't belong to the synced group as well

h3. Notes
The Atlassian account username update for the affected users may happen randomly. However there are no known triggers so far
fields.summary: Improve the username update behavior for linked G Suite instance users that are not included in the synced group

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
User is not able to upload an image header from the user profile

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Access user profile from https://id.atlassian.com/manage-profile/profile-and-visibility
# Select *Update your header image*
# Error pops up "Ops, something went wrong"

h3. Expected Results
Header image updated accordingly. 

h3. Actual Results
Error from the Jira:
 !image-2020-04-08-17-14-52-401.png|thumbnail! 
The below exception is thrown in the xxxxxxx.log file:
{code}
{"error":{"code":"JwtAuthoriser:AuthenticationError","title":"Token verification failed: invalid signature","href":"https://api.media.atlassian.com#UnauthorizedError"}}
{code}

h3. Workaround
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Error when uploading header image from user profile.
Provide users that face login issues with quick troubleshooting help and a direct way to reach out to support

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Sometimes, the group membership for a synced group in the site does not match the group membership with the SCIM directory data

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Setup User provisioning with a third party IDP
 # Provision some groups from the IDP to the site
 # Turn on provisioning from the IDP to run the initial sync
 # Wait for awhile and allow the data to be synced
 # Check the group membership synced

h3. Expected Results

The group membership on the site matches with the AD groups on the IDP.

h3. Actual Results

From the User provisioning configuration page, the group membership shows the expected count and matches with the group members 
 of the AD groups. There should be no errors reported for those group in the Troubleshooting log section. This indicates that the sync from the IDP to the SCIM directory was successful.

 !dir group.png|thumbnail! 

On the site (https://<site>.atlassian.net/admin/group), the provisioned group does not have the correct group members. 

_*Note* : This bug does not apply if the User provisioning configuration page reports errors for the groups or the group summary does not match with the data on the AD groups._. 

h3. Workaround

The scim directory data may not be in sync with the site group data. 

1. Add or remove group members on the AD group to trigger another sync.
2. If problem persists, please contact Atlassian support.
fields.summary: Site group membership not in sync with SCIM directory data

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When you try to impersonate a user that is using *Dansk/Danish* language on profile settings, the button to "switch back" doesn't appear.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Ask for a user to change the language to *Dansk/Danish* on *profile settings > account preferences*.
 # Try to impersonate that user.

h3. Expected Results

The "switch back" button should appear.
h3. Actual Results

The "switch back" button doesn't appear and you should log out every time and log in again in your main account.

h3. Workaround

Ask for the user to use another language instead of *Danish* and the user can be impersonated.
fields.summary: Impersonate "switch back" button not available in Danish

fields.description:
With the addition of Trello to Atlassian Access, it now uses the generic Atlassian Account.

However, in Trello one could customize the initials of their user, while in the Atlassian Account, this is no longer possible.

Please provide the possibility of customizing the initials for the Atlassian Account as well.
fields.summary: Support setting of initials in Atlassian account for profile avatar

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When a site admin use 'Login as user' feature, the *Switch back* option to login as the site-admin account is not working. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Login as one user 
# Use the Switch back option to login as the original account

h3. Expected Results
- The site admin should be able to switch back to the original account without issue. 

h3. Actual Results
- Switch back option to original account is not working. The browser console is throwing the error below. 
{code}
https://<site>.atlassian.net/gateway/api/adminhub/um/site/undefined/users/5b0fe6095c9a7940e417bec1/impersonate/release 403
{code}

h3. Workaround
- No workaround

fields.description:
h4. Problem Definition
At the moment, when exporting organization members via the "Export Accounts" function under managed accounts, it does not include the group membership of these users.

h4. Suggested Solution
Provide the Ability to include the group membership when exporting organization members via the "Export Accounts" function under managed accounts. This functionality is already available when exporting the users at a site level.

h4. Workaround
None at the moment.
fields.summary: Ability to include the group membership when exporting organization members via the "Export Accounts" function under managed accounts

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When special characters (for example, Æ, Ø, Å) are added as a first letter to the account names in id.atlassian.com, the initials from the user profile will be removed.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Login to https://id.atlassian.com/ > Profile and visibility > About you > Full name
# Add a special character as a first letter in the account full name
# The initials from the user account avatar are removed.

h3. Expected Results
The account initials should be shown even when a special character is used in the user name of the account.

h3. Actual Results
The user initials in the avatar are removed.

h3. Workaround
There is no workaround at the moment
fields.summary: Special characters in the account name removes initials in the avatar

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

After changing the email address of a managed account to an unmanaged one, the SAML link for the account persists on the unmanaged account causing problems. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Login via SAML using a managed account
 # Change the email address of the managed account to unmanaged. 

h3. Expected Results

After converting to an unmanaged account, the SAML link should clear out. 

h3. Actual Results

The SAML link generated on the managed account persists after the email address change. 

h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: SAML link persists for unmanaged accounts

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Azure will sometimes report a 500 internal server error for provisioning into Atlassian. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Setup provisioning between Azure AD and Atlassian Access
 # Azure will regularly call the Atlassian SCIM APIs to check if the synced data is up to date or to update data. 

h3. Actual Results

Azure will sometime receive a 500 internal server error response from the API calls and will warn the users. 
{code}
While attempting to validate our authorization to access your System for Cross Domain Identity Management service, we received this unexpected response:
Received response from Web resource.

Resource: https://api.atlassian.com/scim/directory/<DIRECTORYID>/scim/XXXX
Operation: GET
Response Status Code: InternalServerError
Response Content: 
{"timestamp":"20XX-XX-XXT11:52:31.911+0000",
"status":500,
"error":"Internal Server Error",
"exception":"com.netflix.zuul.exception.ZuulException",
"message":"GENERAL"}
{code}

Or in some cases, Azure will receive the same 500 response but a different exception:
{code}
Resource: https://api.atlassian.com/scim/directory/<DIRECTORYID>/scim/XXXX
Operation: GET
Response Status Code: InternalServerError
Response Content: 
{"timestamp":"20XX-XX-XXT11:52:31.911+0000",
"status":500,
"error":"Internal Server Error",
"exception":"io.atlassian.stargate.GatewayException",
"message":"GENERAL"}
{code}

h3. Expected Results

There should be better handling for the message by Azure or messaging for the 500 response code should be improved.

h3. Workaround

When Azure encounters an error, there will be a retry mechanism that will kick in. Usually the message can be ignored. If the Atlassian Cloud app in Azure has been quarantined due to too much errors, contact support.
fields.summary: Azure reporting 500 internal server error for provisioning

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
At this moment, users and admins have only the https://id.atlassian.com/manage/api-tokens webpage to track the usage of the API Token. However, the page shows only when was the last time the Token was used.

h3. Suggested Solution
Have more complete logs about the usage, such as IP address, the agent who accessed it, and more entries.

h3. Why this is important
This can be seen as a security breach according to some companies security policies.

h3. Workaround 
At this moment, there is none.
fields.summary: Have more thorough logs about the API Token usage

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When an account is managed within an organization that implements SSO, the email address of that account cannot be changed to an address that is not under the organization's claimed domains. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
1. Claim a domain and setup SSO 
2. Change a managed account's email address to an address that is not under the organization's claimed domains. 

ie. user@domainwithSSO.com -> user@anotherdomain.com

3. A verification email will be sent to the new email address. 

 !verify.png|thumbnail! 


h3. Expected Results

When verifying the change, the end user should be redirected to the current account's SSO. Once authenticated, the email address change should complete. 

h3. Actual Results

 !password.png|thumbnail! 

User is prompted to enter the account's Atlassian login password to complete. Since the account is still enforced with SSO, there is no available password to use here. 


h3. Workaround
[Contact support|https://support.atlassian.com/contact/] and mention them about this bug(ID-7435)
fields.summary: SSO blocks email address change

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Users on instances where "Approve any domain" has been selected at Site Access page, will also see the following screen at the Site Access page. There is an incorrect message here implying that only Trusted Users can add/invite user, see item circled in red below. For this option, any and all users can invite other users.
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail!
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a Basic user with the simple configuration
 # Go to Administration - > Site access - > Approved domains select "Approve any domain". The other settings are set as default.
 # Please note the highlighted section in the screenshots which says only Site admin and trusted users can invite anyone to any product.
 # Login as a Basic user
 # Go to Projects - > Create project - > Try a next-gen project to create a new project
 # Go to Project settings -> Access -> Add people. It allows inviting anyone from any domain

h3. Expected Results
 # When selecting the options below, updates that mention only site admins and trusted users can invite other users should be removed.
 # Go to Administration - > Site access - > Approved domains select "Approve any domain". The other settings are set as default.

h3. Actual Results

There is confusion caused to admins on the screen above, there is the implication that only Trusted users can invite user. This is incorrect as the basic user is now also able to invite users.
h3. Workaround

At Site Access select *Don't approve any domain* so that only Site admins and trusted users can invite anyone to any product(s).
fields.summary: Non Trusted Users of instances with Site Access set to "Approve any domain" can approve all users

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
At the moment it is not possible to add a user's manager information in their profile and visibility settings

h3. Suggested Solution
Add the ability to add a user's manager information in their profile settings.
fields.summary: Ability to add manager's information in users profile and visibility settings

fields.description:
At the moment, once you have Gsuite integration, all your user details will be sync to your Atlassian account including your full name. It would be beneficial for the user to disallow name to be sync to Atlassian account so that they could keep their name from Google side. 

h4. Current Behavior

User details will be synced to Atlassian Account

h4. Suggestion

To have the ability to choose if the user wanted the user details to be sync to Jira.
fields.summary: Ability to disallow name to be sync from Gsuite integration

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When you put or name with a special character such as Cyrillic or Romanian name from id.atlassian.com. A weird encoding will be breaking the name form the marketplace or community. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a name with a special character
# Accessing marketplace or community
# Noticed that your name contains weird encoding such as "��"

h3. Expected Results
The name will be displayed correctly as per the Jira account.

h3. Actual Results
Name contains weird encoding. 

 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

 !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail! 
h3. Workaround

 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Name with special character contains weird encoding from Atlassian System

fields.description:
{panel:borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#6A8EB3 |bgColor=#F8F8F8}
A fix for this behavior was deployed to production on March 5, 2020. The 5K limit will only be applied to managed accounts, that is, synced accounts that are related to the domains listed under your [Organization|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/organization-administration-938859734.html] (at *Directory* > *Domains*).

That being said, this bug will be closed :)
{panel}

h3. Issue Summary
When syncing unmanaged accounts (not related to your verified domains at Atlassian side) those will still count as a synced user even knowing that it is not a valid one. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a [user provisioning|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/user-provisioning-959305316.html] integration 
# Sync both managed and unmanaged users from you IdP

h3. Expected Results
If you have more than 5000 accounts (from both your verified and unverified domain) only the accounts related to the verified domain(s) should count towards the sync.

h3. Actual Results
All accounts count towards the sync.

h3. Workaround
In this scenario there are two options:
- *Delete the accounts at the IdP* (you can do that with a tool at the IdP or by using the [SCIM REST API|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/admin/user-provisioning/rest/#api-scim-directory-directoryId-Users-userId-patch] to create a script)
- *Recreate the external directory at Atlassian*
fields.summary: Unmanaged accounts provisioned through SCIM counts towards the 5000 users' external directory limit

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When a single GSuite has been connected to two different cloud sites, users in the organisation will be sent multiple notifications that their organization integrated with Google
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Setup domain users in GSuite
 # Connect GSuite with an *.atlassian.net site
 # Connect the same GSuite with a second *.atlassian.net site

h3. Expected Results

The 1st connection should be superseded (and stopped) or the 2nd connection should be blocked from being connected.
h3. Actual Results

2 sites have been connected to the same GSuite. The domain will be reclaimed back and forth between the 2 organizations, with the end users will receiving notifications each time that happens:
{quote}Your administrator made some changes to your account Just a heads up!
 Your administrator for <domain> connected your organization to Google Apps
{quote}
Users will also receive notifications regarding the [Trello Changes|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/manage-accounts-with-trello-access-980454116.html]
h3. Workaround

Disconnect GSuite from one of the *.atlassian.net sites.
fields.summary: Multiple notifications for GSuite integrations from two different site

fields.description:
h4. Summary
When configuring Azure to use the user.mail as the Unique User Identifier (Name ID), the IDP initiated log in will not work, giving the following error:

 !image-2018-11-01-18-56-54-426.png|thumbnail! 

And on the URL there will be more details:
{code}
https://id.atlassian.com/error?client_id=<redacted>&connection=<redacted>&lang=en-US%2Cen%3Bq%3D0.9%2Cpt%3Bq%3D0.8&error=access_denied&error_description=verify-saml-domains%3Amalformed-email-address&tracking=<redacted>
{code}

h4. How to reproduce
# When integrating with Azure, the recommended set up is to use the Unique User Identifier (or Name ID) as user.mail.
# Add the Relay State as your instance's URL

h5. Expected behaviour
You are able to launch your Atlassian Cloud application on myapps.microsoft.com (IDP initaited log in)

h5. Actual result
This set up will cause a malfunction from Azure when sending the Name ID on the SAML response, it's an unidentifiable string instead of the user's email address.

h4. Additional notes
This problem is not reproducible if you use user.userprincipalname as the Name ID, but this will not always serve as a workaround as the information on this field may not be the same as for the user.mail field, a validation of the Name ID sent on the SAML Response is needed before using it as workaround on your configuration.
fields.summary: IDP initiated log in with Azure is not working with Name ID set as user.mail

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Users still can edit *Full name*, *Job title*, *Department* and *Organization* fields on their Atlassian Accounts details at [https://id.atlassian.com/manage-profile] even when user provisioning is enabled. This should not happen and might be disruptive to the company since the information may not reflect the information that is on their internal directory.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Enable [User provisioning|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/user-provisioning-959305316.html]
 # Sync a user
 # Ask the user to access [https://id.atlassian.com/manage-profile] and change one of those fields

When the user does this manual change it overwrites the field. Unless the IdP sends a PATCH to update that information the field won't reflect the IdP information.
h3. Expected Results

When User provisioning enables the users should not be able to edit those fields. The Org admins which should have that ability for edge cases don't have.
h3. Actual Results

The users can edit them.
h3. Workaround

To get the information reflecting the IdP side you should trigger a change on the users' profile there. Each IdP implemented the [User provisioning REST API|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/admin/user-provisioning/rest/] differently so it is recommended that you engage their support team gets more details on how they trigger those updates.
fields.summary: Some fields are still editable at https://id.atlassian.com/manage-profile even with SCIM integration enabled

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

For some connected sites, the G Suite admin UI is showing the 'Something went wrong' screen, preventing reconfiguration, disconnection or viewing actual status.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Visit [https://admin.atlassian.com/] and navigate to the G Suite tab
 # Step 2

h3. Expected Results

For a connected site, details of the most recent synchronisation.
h3. Actual Results
{quote}Something went wrong
G Suite configuration could not be retrieved.
{quote}
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Admin UI for G Suite integration shows 'G Suite configuration could not be retrieved' for some connected sites

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Users re-activated, or re-created, in Google do not have "Has access on site" enabled by the G Suite integration.

Re-creation is when an Google user is created with the same email address as a previously deleted user.
h3. Steps to Reproduce

Where [G Suite integration|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/g-suite-integration-938859740.html] is in use:
 # Un-suspend a previously suspended user in G Suite
 # Wait for the user to be synced by the G Suite integration

h3. Expected Results

The user has "Has access on site" enabled.
h3. Actual Results

The user does not have "Has access on site" enabled.
h3. Workaround

Manually toggle ""Has access on site" via user management
fields.summary: GSuite integration is not enabling "Has access on site" when a user is re-activated or re-created

fields.description:
Hi,
I would like to open this Feature Request regarding this issue:

Customer had issues to re-sync his G Suite and in order to achieve this he had to remove and re-add the Gsuite account.

The suggestion is that there is a way that customer can update the password without removing the entire GSuite account because removing and re-adding causes that everyone connected receives a notification of a change and also removes all groups.

Customer commented: 
"You could allow a re login without causing a change to the entire system.
That's how most services like this work. Oh, sync failed? Please reenter
credentials or reinitiate the sync to fix as opposed to having to remove it
entirely which causes system wide changes."
fields.summary: GSuite stopped syncing

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When cookies are blocked in Safari, login returns an error message telling the customer to contact that the identity provider has problems. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Block all cookies in Safari settings
 # Login to https://id.atlassian.com

h3. Expected Results

The browser should return an error indicating that cookies are not allowed. 

h3. Actual Results

Error returned : There seems to be a problem with your identity provider. 

 !Screen Shot 2020-02-14 at 2.21.05 PM.png|thumbnail! 

This is incorrectly returned even if the login account does not use SAML-SSO


h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: ID returns an incorrect message when cookies are blocked from Safari

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
At this moment, after a user authenticated using OKTA, the session will remain active even if the device's network is changed (from an internal network to LTE network, for example).

h3. Suggested Solution
Jira Cloud should trigger the OKTA authentication process whenever the device's network changes.

h3. Why this is important
This can be seen as a security breach according to some companies security policies.

h3. Workaround 
At this moment, there is none.
fields.summary: Jira Cloud should trigger the OKTA authentication process whenever the device's network changes

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
It is possible to set as *Default Access Group* groups that are synced with external directories through SCIM. When doing so, Marketplace apps when installed,* will be added to that group to gain access to the Application* (this is not visible to end-users, third-party apps users are hidden). After the first sync *SCIM will remove the app user from the group*, revoking the third-party app access from the application.

Groups synced through SCIM can be identified with the lock, as the screenshot below:
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail!

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# [Configure SCIM|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/configure-user-provisioning-966659579.html#Configureuserprovisioning-Configureproductaccessfortheprovisionedgroupsandusers]
# Sync a group and make it the *Default Access Group*.
# Install an app (i.e: we tested with *PagerDuty* connector).
# Check for actions that need application access, possibly 403's will happen.

h3. Expected Results
* SCIM does not remove third-party app accounts from the access groups.

h3. Actual Results
* The sync removes the access from the groups and the app has no access to Jira.

h3. Workaround
Add groups that are not synced to also be default access groups.
fields.summary: Syncing default access groups with external directory (SCIM) can remove add-ons application access

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

A subset of users who use Microsoft's Social Login will now need to use another method of login. These users will hit the error page below , when they use this login method :
 !image-2020-02-07-19-01-26-617.png|width=524,height=425!
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Use the Login with Microsoft feature
 # Enter the user's Microsoft login and password

h3. Expected Results

User should be able to proceed directly to their landing page at Atlassian , commonly {{[https://start.atlassian.com|https://start.atlassian.com/]}}
h3. Actual Results

For now these subset of users will be forced to re-login using the Atlassian login flow. 
h3. Workaround

Click the *"Try logging in again"* button

Use login password form. If the user does not have a password or know of one use the Reset Password link to set one [https://id.atlassian.com/login/resetpassword]

For users of Azure AD who do not have SAML configured there is no restricting on logging in with a username and password, social login with Microsoft is a convenience feature but is not enforced.
h3. Notes
 * As a result of the fix, you may hit into some small inconsistencies with the browser.
 * Please clear your browser cache, reset your Atlassian Account password ({{[https://id.atlassian.com/login/resetpassword]}}) and try again. That should fix it.
fields.summary: Some customers logging in using Microsoft Social Login flow will be blocked and asked to relogin

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
By default , a site administrator account will automatically have all application access. The application access can be removed by removing the account from the product access group.  However, in the profile , it still showing as the account have all application access :-

 !Screenshot 2020-01-30 at 6.22.16 PM.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Give an account "Site administrator" role
 # Automatically , all application access will enabled.
# Then , verify from "Product Access" which group have JIRA Service Desk application access , for example "jira-servicedesk-users" group
# Then , remove the account from "jira-servicedesk-users". 

h3. Expected Results
The account no longer included to JIRA Service Desk license, and the application access in the profile disabled.

h3. Actual Results
The account no longer included in the JIRA Service Desk license, but from the profile, the application access still enabled.

h3. Workaround
No workaround.
fields.summary: For site administrator profile, the application access are not disabled after removing the product access group from the account

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Customers are facing login errors when their computer clock is off or out of sync with a time server. (e.g. if the computer clock is 5 min behind. )

This seems to be impacting customers with 2FA.

This time discrepancy will trigger an error message when trying to login:

"Oops, that didn't work!

Try again in a moment"

 

!1.png!
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Have 2FA enabled
 # Have a computed with an off sync clock

h3. Expected Results
 * Users to be able to log in, or at least get a message explaining why they're unable to login.

h3. Actual Results
 * Users receive a generic error message and are unable to login:

h3. Workaround

To solve this error, sync the computer clock with a time server, this should do the trick :)
fields.summary: Users with 2FA unable to login if their computer clock is out of sync

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

If a site-admin impersonates a user and then clicks on *switch back* to stop impersonating the user, if you click on browser's back button, the pop-up will keep appearing and the *switch back* link will not do anything
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Impersonate a user
 # A pop-up will appear to switch back to your user. Click on *switch back*
 # When you're redirected to User Management page, click on *browser's back button*

h3. Expected Results

The site-admin user should not see the switch back pop-up.
h3. Actual Results

The switch back pop-up will keep appearing even if you close the window.

 

Note: Some users reported that they were also able to reproduce this issue in a bit different way:
 # Impersonate a user
 # A pop-up will appear to switch back to your user. Click on *switch back*
 # Close the browser
 # Open it again, and access the Instance. You will be logged with the original account, but the pop up will still appear, and the *switch back* link will not do anything

h3. Workaround

A manual workaround is to have the admin to navigate to {{<siteurl>/impersonate}}, which will reset the impersonate function. e.g. [acme.atlassian.net/impersonate|http://acme.atlassian.net/impersonate]
fields.summary: After impersonating a user, the "switch back" pop-up can still appear

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
 * When Atlassian accounts are tied to an Atlassian purchasing system/Sales OPs/Channel Partner account, the Atlassian account can't be deleted and can only be deactivated
 * The current messaging is "This account is an Expert."
 * Many customers aren't aware of our terminology and what "Expert" actually means, so customers are unaware that the account is linked to Atlassian Sales OPs systems

h3. Suggested Solution
 * Describe what an "Expert" is within the error message
 * Add the Sales OPs support portal URL(or a link to a KB) and describe how to create a "Partner Program Support" ticket

h3. Why this is important
 * "This account is an Expert." is ambiguous
 * Cloud Support will need to redirect users to the Sales OPs team - so it would be beneficial if customers are immediately directed to the correct support portal

h3. Workaround
 * Navigate here: https://partners.atlassian.com/support/#/
 !Screen Shot 2020-01-15 at 13.48.25.png|thumbnail! 
 (Fill the form as per above screenshot)
 * The Sales OPs support team will assist with your enquiry
 * "Expert" accounts can only be deactivated and not deleted
fields.summary: Improve the "This account is an Expert." message when deleting an Atlassian account

fields.description:
h3.Summary

The U.S. law prohibits Atlassian, an Australian corporation with offices in the United States, from providing access to our products and services to organizations or End Users located in the following countries and regions; Crimea Region of Ukraine, Cuba, Iran, North Korea, Syria, Sudan.

A notification or warning when users from the mentioned region/countries keys in their number will be helpful. Currently there is no indicator on the UI when the phone number is keyed in which leads to customer expecting a SMS from Atlassian (which never arrives due to US sanction).
fields.summary: Notification to inform customer from sanction countries/regions of potential errors when keying in phone number for 2FA SMS setup

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
In the site access page, the site-admin has the option to whitelist certain domains, so that users in those domains can join automatically. Right under that box, there is a note saying "We'll notify you about all new users". However, this contradicts the tick box for notifications about new users signup at the bottom of the same page

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Navigate to the site administration area, the Site Access page
 # Notice the text right under the whitelisted domain list

 !domain_whitelist.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results
If site-admins have an option to disable notifications when users join, the text saying that they will get a notification anyway is false

h3. Actual Results
The 2 texts contradict each other

h3. Workaround

 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Site admis can disable notifications for when a user in the whitelisted domain joins the site. This contradicts the text right under the whitelisted domain list

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

It's possible to create invalid email accounts in id.atlassian.com e.g: *$&#@gmail.com, ^%$@gmail.com, these accounts shouldn't be allowed only letters, numbers and (.)

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go id.atlassian.com
 # Create sign up for an account with an invalid email ^%$@gmail.com

h3. Expected Results

Validation would bare users from creating these accounts.

h3. Actual Results

An account gets created, which would allow these accounts on a Cloud instance, possibly causing issues if the customer exported this data and tried to import on another Cloud instance.

h3. Workaround

Not at the moment.

A validation similar to what Gmail has would be great:

 !Screen Shot 2020-01-17 at 16.34.09.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Email creation on id.atlassian.com allows the creation of invalid email accoutns

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

In the "Product access" page ( of User management) , if we want to add a group to a certain product ( say Jira software) , we click on 'Add group' and search for the group. Problem is , if there are more than 20 groups with the same keyword ( for eg : "a-users", "b-users",..etc ) then a search for exact group name "users' is not returned. As the search is currently limited to showing just 20 results.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create 20+ groups with the name "a-users", "b-users", "c-users" and so on till "v-users".
 # Create another group called "users".
 # Navigate to _User management --> Product access_ page. Click on 'Add group' for any of the product
 # A pop-up appears to search for the group name. Search for "users". This group is not returned in the search results.

h3. Expected Results
 * The group "users" should be returned.

h3. Actual Results
 * Currently its only restricted to 20 results, which is not allowing to add "users" group. ( refer screenshot)

h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behaviour. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Adding a group on Product access page does not return the group name in search result, if more than 20 groups with same keyword are present.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Users cannot log into Jira if they have the Chrome extension "Popup Blocker" installed

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Clear the Chrome cache to make sure any session is active
# Install the extension "Popup Blocker" in Chrome
# Try to access a Jira cloud site

h3. Expected Results

The user is authenticated and the Jira home page is displayed

h3. Actual Results

The user receives the following error message:

{quote}Oops, you've made a malformed request{quote}

 !Screen Shot 2020-01-08 at 7.30.32 PM.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

* Disable or uninstall the Chrome extension "Popup Blocker"
* Use Chrome incognito mode
* Use a different browser
fields.summary: Users cannot log into Jira if they have the Chrome extension "Popup Blocker" installed

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
The removed user still comes up under the newly introduced people section

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Assign issues to a user and let the user work on it so that it comes up in the user comes under the 'You work section' in the people Tab
 # Revoke the site access of the user and still, the users come in the people section

h3. Expected Results
Once a users sites access is revoked, the user details should get removed from the people section as well.

h3. Actual Results

The users still come up in the people section even after the user is removed


h3. Workaround

No workaround
fields.summary: The removed user still comes up under the newly introduced people section

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When you have an annual license with all the product slots in use and you chance a user from *Basic* to *Trusted* that doesn't have access to that product, the system will return the following message.
{quote}We couldn't assign Trusted to _This User_
 You've reached the maximum number of users for one of your products. To assign a role to this user, upgrade your plan.
{quote}
When you refresh the page, in the UI the user will be displayed with the *Trusted User* label and all the products activated, however, the license will not be included and the user will not be an actual *Trusted User*.

You can check this bug in the following video.
 * [^Trusted_user.mov]

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Access a site with an annual license with all the slots full.
 # Change a user that doesn't have access to a product that has no available licenses from *Basic* to *Trusted User*.
 # The system will return a message saying that it's not possible to finish the operation.
 # Refresh the page.

h3. Expected Results

Since in the backend the user is still a *Basic* user, the UI should not display the *Trusted User* label nor the products as active.
h3. Actual Results

In the UI the user is displayed as a *Trusted User* even being a *Basic*.
h3. Workaround

Change the user back to *Basic*.
fields.summary: The account is converted to Trusted User in the UI without available licenses.
Inconsistent result for Worked on result from People page

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When using REST API to retrieve all groups in an instance it's not possible to paginate the results, meaning it won't be possible to fetch or paginate all groups in a Cloud instance.

- https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/rest/v3/#api-rest-api-3-groups-picker-get

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Have more than 20 groups in a Cloud instance
 # Access https://cloudsite.atlassian.com/rest/api/3/groups/picker

h3. Expected Results

Either an option to paginate the result would exist or all the groups would be returned this way.

h3. Actual Results

Only the 20 first groups are returned.

h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no workaround for this behavior.
fields.summary: Not possible to paginate results on the Groups Picker REST API

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Users can manually be removed from the SCIM synced groups when viewing their User Details within User Management

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Configure an Atlassian Organization User Provisioning and PUSH Groups with members into the Cloud Site
# Locate a Pushed User within the Cloud Site's User Management and view their Details
# Navigate to the Groups section, click on the ellipsis icon for a Pushed Group (indicated with a Padlock Icon), and Remove User From Group 

h3. Expected Results
An Admin should not be able to edit the membership of Pushed Groups as these Groups controlled/managed by the IdP with SCIM/User Provisioning

h3. Actual Results
User can be removed from the Pushed Groups including the "All Members in Directory" group created by Atlassian
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 
 !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail! 

It is not possible to manually add or remove Users from Pushed Groups:
 !screenshot-3.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
The IdP should be able to add Users back into any synced Push Group, however, the User may not be pushed back into the "All Members in Directory" group
fields.summary: Users can be removed from SCIM Groups via User Details

fields.description:
User has requested if we can support WebAuthn for Bitbucket Cloud, login without a password, but only username + security key.
 
Since authentication in Bitbucket Cloud is done with the linked Atlassian account, I believe this would only be possible if it was supported on the Atlassian account level.
fields.summary: Support WebAuthn for Atlassian accounts

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition  

Currently, when customers add a user to the site, they are automatically counted towards the license of the application even if they are in an "invitation pending" status. This seems not fair to the customer as the customer should only be charged when the user successfully joins the site. 
h3. Suggested Solution

Count the user in the license after the first login of the user to the site.
h3. Workaround

Invite users without any application access and provide them the required application access after they successfully accept the invitation.
fields.summary: Count user towards the license after the user successfully joins the site

fields.description: On user management page, the status of users could be 'Deactivated' instead of 'No site access'.
fields.summary: Label users as 'Deactivated' instead of 'No site access'

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
User iaaliahmad@gmail.com is disabled. 
Checked Splunk to verify if the user has flagged the Atlassian account for deletion but it seems like he didn't: https://splunk.paas-inf.net/en-US/app/search/search?sid=1576681383.839076_2326B28B-B8FD-4BA2-BA3E-48E8244F5823

h3. Steps to Reproduce
Username	iaaliahmad@gmail.com
Atlassian account ID	5db13d232299c90da01332f6

h3. Expected Results
the account should be active

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
* When trying to change the Atlassian account password via id.atlassian.com > Security > "Change your password", it's not obvious that the "Current password" field is mandatory
* Some users are trying to change their password because the current password is not known to them - access to the Atlassian account can be granted via a magic link or via an already active session

h3. Suggested Solution
* Mark the field as required
* Display a  tooltip similar to below, but not as wordy:
 !Screenshot 2019-11-26 at 08.28.38.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Why this is important
* Some users have logged in via a magic link and don't know their password
* Some users have forgotten their password, but still have an active session - they'd like to reset their password but don't know how to reset their password
* Can cause friction because customers may be under the impression that their account doesn't have a password, but they are prompted for a password in order to be able to change their password
 
h3. Workaround 
* Users must enter their current password and new password in order to enable the  "Save changes" button
* Atlassian account passwords can be reset via https://id.atlassian.com/login/resetpassword - users will need to log out if not logged out already
fields.summary: Display a tooltip/mark "Current password" field as required when users are trying to change their password via id.atlassian.com

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Customers utilizing a Proxy/VPN Service are receiving notifications from Atlassian that their connection is unusual, however, the Location returned is incorrect

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Connect to a Proxy/VPN Service (like zScaler)
# Access the Atlassian Cloud Environment

h3. Expected Results
Location shown in email accurately reflects where the user is connected through

h3. Actual Results
User receives a notification indicating that there is unusual activity with their account. 

Email received
{noformat}
Hello,
We noticed some unusual login activity with your Atlassian account.
Email <EMAIL ADDRESS>

Time Thursday, November xx, 2019 hh:mm AM (America/New_York)
Location Pleasant Prairie, Wisconsin, United States
Device Unknown
Browser Chrome
IP address 165.225.x.xx3
To make sure your account is secure, let us know if this was you.
{noformat}

If the IP Address is checked/looked up using an online tool, the location is correct:
{code}| => curl https://ipapi.co/165.225.x.xx3/json
{
    "ip": "165.225.x.xx3",
    "city": "Chicago",
    "region": "Illinois",
    "region_code": "IL",
    "country": "US",
    "country_name": "United States",
    "continent_code": "NA",
    "in_eu": false,
    "postal": "60602",
    "latitude": 41.8483,
    "longitude": -87.6517,
    "timezone": "America/Chicago",
    "utc_offset": "-0600",
    "country_calling_code": "+1",
    "currency": "USD",
    "languages": "en-US,es-US,haw,fr",
    "asn": "AS22616",
    "org": "ZSCALER, INC."
}{code}

h3. Workaround

If the IP Returned in this notification is recognized, acknowledge the message by clicking "This was me" in the notification.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition (last updated on 13/Nov/2019)
Currently, the [Atlassian Account deletion process|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/delete-your-atlassian-account-961259508.html] have a 14-day grace period that allow the Org Admin to cancel it. That long grace period is not ideal depending on the companies policies. 

h3. Suggested Solutions
- Reduce the grace period to something like 3 days or so. 
- Create a button at the users' profile in the Org that allow the admins to expedite the account deletion.
fields.summary: Make it possible for Org Admins to expedite the Atlassian account deletion

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Once a user is removed from a Cloud site his associations to roles present at the projects *People* section will remain untouched.

The current behavior helps admins if a specific user returns to the company but can cause permission problems in case a new user is invited with the same email that was being used by the old off-boarded user.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Invite a user to your Cloud site.
# Add the user to a role inside one of your JIRA projects.
# Remove the user from your site.

h3. Expected Results

The user should be removed from the roles he was associated so if a new user got the same email no permission would be miss granted.
This also means that if the user would be added back to the site he would need to be added to the permissions manually once again. 

h3. Actual Results

The user is removed but he remains associated with the project roles.
In case you try to grant more roles to that entry the following error is displayed:
 !Screen Shot 2019-11-13 at 12.17.31.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

Manually delete the user entry from the People section of your projects.
fields.summary: Removing a user from the instance

fields.description:
h3. Summary

The [Session duration|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/session-duration-management-976763148.html] feature allows session timeout under a specified duration when the session is idle.

Interactions can be active (a user clicks a button) or passive (an open page auto-refreshes).

The notification services are also considered as a passive interaction which means by keeping your browser open, the session will remain active and not go idle despite not having Jira open.

h3. Proposed solution

Exclude the notification services from being a passive interaction to assure once Jira isn't being used, the session is able to go in idle mode and timeout.
fields.summary: Improve what is considered passive interaction for session duration

Currently, there is no easy way for a user to know that the domain of the email address will [update its account to|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloudkb/changing-atlassian-account-email-addresses-969508513.html] is [managed|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/managed-accounts-873871203.html]/verified. That could cause some unwanted side effects such as losing the ability to change the account's email address.

h3. Suggested Solutions
Create a message, such as the example below, that informs the customer that the destination email address is managed by an [Organization|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/organization-administration-938859734.html]:
{quote}
(!) You are about to change your account's email address to a [verified domain|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/verify-a-domain-for-your-organization-873871234.html]. With that your account will be [managed|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/managed-accounts-873871203.html] by the owner of that domain claim from now on. Do you want to proceed?
{quote}

fields.description:
{panel:title=Call for prototype testing}
Hi all,

Thank you so much for your votes and comments on ‘Force managed accounts to log out.’

We have created a prototype to address the feedback and would like to invite admins that are using Atlassian Administration to take part in an upcoming usability test study.

What’s involved in the study:

Sessions are about 30 minutes long and conducted via Zoom.

I’m hoping to schedule sessions beginning next week. Once we schedule the session, you will receive a calendar invite to a Zoom conference.

We’ll start with a general discussion to get to know you. We will then dive deeper into your experience to learn about how you’d like to require your users to log out. Lastly, we will share a prototype with you to get your feedback.

If you’re interested in taking part, please email me at [jwu3@atlassian.com|mailto:jwu3@atlassian.com], and I will contact you to schedule a time to meet.

We look forward to hearing from you.

Cheers,
 Jesse Wu
 Designer for Atlassian Administration, Access and Security
{panel}
*Problem*
 It's not possible to force users to log out in the *Session duration* tab on the admin page. The workaround is the *Reset password* feature in the *Org* > *Security* > *Password management* tab. That button has two different outcomes beyond ending the managed accounts' session depending on having SAML SSO or not:
h3. Scenario 1: SAML SSO is enabled
 - The users will have their Atlassian Account session terminated and when they try to log in, they will be redirected to the Identity Provider authentication page. The users *won't* be asked to create a new password, *nor* receive any notification.

h3. Scenario 2: SAML SSO is *not* enabled
 - The users will have their Atlassian Account session terminated and when they try to log in, after entering their current credentials, they will be prompt to create a new password. This new password must respect the Organization's [password policies].

*Suggestion*
 Notify your users about when the logout will happen so they can avoid losing their current work. If you do changes to the session duration it might be worth it to let them know as well.
fields.summary: Force managed accounts to log out

Oops, you've made a malformed request.

h3. Summary

When attempting to configure SMS-based 2FA with a Lithuanian (LT) phone number, the verification of the phone number fails - the number appears to be invalid, even though it's valid.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Attempt to configure 2FA for an Atlassian Account.

 # Click on "_Don't have a smartphone?_" and then click on _Enable using SMS_

 # For the country code, choose LT (Lithuania). The prefix +370 will be added.

 # Add the rest of the phone number. 

h3. Expected Results

Since the phone number is valid, an SMS should be received
h3. Actual Results

An error is thrown and an exclamation mark (!) is shown next to the phone number, indicating that it's invalid
 The browser console shows a 403 "The request was a legal request, but the server is refusing to respond to it"

  !image-2019-10-23-12-02-36-626.png|width=617,height=283!
h3. Workaround

No direct workaround is available for the situation where the user does not have a smartphone.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Managed users (i.e whose domain has been claimed) can setup 2SV at Atlassian Account level using steps at [Two-step verification|https://confluence.atlassian.com/x/oQkvOg]. The flow to recover lost 2SV is broken based on this documentation.
h3. Environment

NA
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Customer is a managed account but without Atlassian Access
 # He sets up 2SV at a personal account level
 # His final screen that he gets stuck at is the below screen
 # Clicking on this screen - makes customer go to    !image-2019-10-23-16-55-08-878.png!
 # Then he is at the page [https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/two-step-verification-976161185.html#Secureyouraccountwithtwo-stepverification-Recoveryouraccount] which only suggests customer contact Support  

h3. Expected Results

Customer should be able to fix this kind of 2SV issues on their own. This is not currently happening
h3. Actual Results

Customer needs to reach out to Support every time for scenarios like these but in fact the resolution/workaround to this issue is dependent on user's organisation administrator to disable his/her 2SV (See workaround below) 
h3. Workaround

At current point of time only Org Admins can unenroll users from 2SV in this flow where users setup 2SV on their own Atlassian Account. Please reach out to respective org admin's to assist to do this. Org Admins should unenroll users as explained under [Temporarily exclude users from two-step verification|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/enforced-two-step-verification-938859738.html#Enforcedtwo-stepverification-Temporarilyexcludeusersfromtwo-stepverification].
{quote}They've lost their phone, and so won't be able to log in........
{quote}
{quote}Users who have two-step verification - excluding such users will disable two-step verification for the their account and allow them to log in with only a password.
{quote}
fields.summary: Managed Users who setup 2SV at Atlassian Account level can never easily recover their lost 2SV

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Checking out time zones it appears our tz database is out of date. This can be seen as the new permanant change for Casablanca to GMT+1 is not reflected.

h3. Environment
Jira - Production

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to [https://id.atlassian.com/manage-profile]
# Browse for *Casablanca* Timezone in *_Location and time zone_* section

h3. Expected Results
Casablanca timezone should be GMT+1

h3. Actual Results
Casablanca timezone is GMT+0
 
h3. Notes

fields.description:
h3. Description

As announced on [Say goodbye to usernames in Atlassian Cloud|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/blog/2018/06/say-goodbye-to-usernames-in-atlassian-cloud] we're moving away from usernames due to [European General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR)|https://www.atlassian.com/blog/announcements/atlassian-and-gdpr-our-commitment-to-data-privacy?_ga=2.147632436.2054399766.1571052388-298345919.1553604624&_gac=1.3337092.1570626111.EAIaIQobChMImNvf_J2P5QIVCXiGCh1TMwuOEAAYASAAEgKUpfD_BwE].

However, for some customers, the option to display *usernames* would still very useful. Seeing that this would be, enable the options to toggle  usernames on/off

h3. Expected Results
* Allow customers to enable and option, on an instance-level, to display *usernames*, instead of Atlassian IDs. 


h3. Examples

* This would be useful when viewing macros in Confluence that reference Jira users.

h3. Observation
 (on) This should include an acknowledge from the customer side on these European laws.
fields.summary: Allow customers to enable and option to display usernames instead of Atlassian IDs
